predict_resonance.description: Predict which social/political tribes will resonate with content

framework.title: TRIBAL RESONANCE THEORY - COMPREHENSIVE FRAMEWORK
framework.intro: Modern political discourse is organized around distinct social/political tribes, each with characteristic moral foundations profiles, narrative styles, and core values. Content resonates with tribes when it activates their dominant moral foundations and employs their preferred rhetorical strategies. Understanding tribal resonance predicts which audiences will amplify or reject a message.

progressive_left.name: PROGRESSIVE LEFT
progressive_left.moral_profile: Very high Care/Harm, very high Fairness/Cheating, very high Liberty/Oppression. Low Loyalty, Authority, Sanctity.
progressive_left.core_values: Social justice, equity, anti-oppression, universal compassion, systemic change
progressive_left.narrative_style: Emphasis on structural analysis, power dynamics, marginalized voices, intersectionality
progressive_left.key_triggers: Suffering of vulnerable groups, inequality, discrimination, social injustice, oppression
progressive_left.rhetorical_patterns: Academic language, theory-heavy, appeals to studies, moral urgency about harm reduction

democratic_establishment.name: DEMOCRATIC ESTABLISHMENT / CENTER-LEFT
democratic_establishment.moral_profile: High Care, high Fairness, moderate Loyalty, moderate Authority, moderate Liberty
democratic_establishment.core_values: Pragmatic reform, institutions, expertise, evidence-based policy, incremental progress
democratic_establishment.narrative_style: Policy wonkism, institutional trust, expert consensus, data-driven
democratic_establishment.key_triggers: Evidence-based solutions, institutional legitimacy, expert opinion, pragmatic compromise
democratic_establishment.rhetorical_patterns: Technocratic, appeals to credentials, moderate tone, coalition-building language

libertarian.name: LIBERTARIAN
libertarian.moral_profile: Very high Liberty/Oppression, high Fairness (procedural), low Authority, low Loyalty
libertarian.core_values: Individual freedom, free markets, limited government, personal responsibility, non-aggression
libertarian.narrative_style: Principled reasoning from first principles, constitutional originalism, economic logic
libertarian.key_triggers: Government overreach, taxation, regulation, individual rights violations, market efficiency
libertarian.rhetorical_patterns: Appeals to freedom, "slippery slope" warnings about tyranny, economic arguments

conservative_establishment.name: CONSERVATIVE ESTABLISHMENT / CENTER-RIGHT
conservative_establishment.moral_profile: Moderate-high across all six foundations (balanced moral matrix)
conservative_establishment.core_values: Free enterprise, individual responsibility, ordered liberty, traditional institutions, gradual reform
conservative_establishment.narrative_style: Emphasis on proven institutions, historical wisdom, unintended consequences, realism
conservative_establishment.key_triggers: Respect for tradition, economic growth, family values, law and order, national security
conservative_establishment.rhetorical_patterns: Appeals to tradition, historical precedent, practical consequences, business prosperity

religious_conservative.name: RELIGIOUS CONSERVATIVE
religious_conservative.moral_profile: Very high Sanctity/Degradation, very high Authority, high Loyalty, moderate Care
religious_conservative.core_values: Traditional morality, religious authority, family values, sanctity of life, moral order
religious_conservative.narrative_style: Biblical references, moral absolutes, faith-based reasoning, eternal truths
religious_conservative.key_triggers: Religious persecution, moral decay, family breakdown, abortion, sexual morality
religious_conservative.rhetorical_patterns: Scripture citations, moral clarity, prophetic warnings, "culture war" framing

populist_right.name: POPULIST RIGHT / MAGA
populist_right.moral_profile: Very high Loyalty, very high Liberty (anti-elite), high Authority (certain leaders), moderate-low Fairness
populist_right.core_values: America First, anti-establishment, nationalist, working-class identity, "common sense"
populist_right.narrative_style: Plain-spoken, anti-elite, conspiratorial about institutions, "us vs. them" framing
populist_right.key_triggers: Betrayal by elites, national sovereignty threats, "real Americans" vs. coastal elites, immigration
populist_right.rhetorical_patterns: Populist language, simple sentences, emotional appeals, anti-expert, tribal signaling

centrist.name: CENTRIST / MODERATE
centrist.moral_profile: Balanced across foundations but lower intensity than ideological tribes
centrist.core_values: Pragmatism, compromise, "both sides have a point", stability, common ground
centrist.narrative_style: "On the one hand... on the other hand", critique of extremes, complexity acknowledgment
centrist.key_triggers: Extreme rhetoric from either side, partisan gridlock, practical solutions, common sense
centrist.rhetorical_patterns: Balanced tone, "reasonable people can disagree", appeals to moderation

apolitical.name: APOLITICAL / DISENGAGED
apolitical.moral_profile: Variable but low activation on political content
apolitical.core_values: Personal life focus, skepticism of politics, practical self-interest, entertainment
apolitical.narrative_style: Avoids political framing, personal stories, immediate relevance
apolitical.key_triggers: Direct impact on daily life, personal safety, entertainment value, non-political hooks
apolitical.rhetorical_patterns: Accessible language, personal relevance, avoids partisan signals

key_insights: Content resonates when it activates a tribe's dominant moral foundations at high intensity
Narrative style matching is crucial: academic language attracts progressives but repels populists
Cross-tribal appeal requires activating shared foundations (Liberty resonates with both libertarians and progressives; Care can bridge left and some religious conservatives)

High polarization occurs when content simultaneously activates positive valence for one tribe's dominant foundations while violating another tribe's (e.g., immigration restriction appeals to Loyalty/Authority for conservatives while violating Care/Fairness for progressives)
The absence of certain foundations can be as revealing as their presence (e.g., no Loyalty/Authority signals = progressive; no Care/Fairness = conservative)
